action.text:
A flaming whip appears in the infernal tormentor's hand or from its greatsword and lashes at a creature the tormentor can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. A creature that has signed a fiendish contract has disadvantage on this save. On a failure, the creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage, is pulled 10 feet closer to the tormentor, and is cursed for 1 minute or until the tormentor uses this action again. This curse also ends if the target enters hallowed ground.
While cursed, the target can't move more than 30 feet from the tormentor. Also while the curse lasts, the target takes 7 (2d6) extra fire damage from the tormentor's greatsword attacks. The tormentor can use a bonus action to move the target 10 feet to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the tormentor. If this space is dangerous, the target receives a new saving throw before moving, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description:
"I knew when she pulled out a gold pen reeking of brimstone that I was making a mistake."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 50

monster.name: Ithjar

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The ithjar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Slippery Serpent
trait.text: The ithjar has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple or saving throws to avoid being paralyzed or restrained.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ithjar attacks once with its bite and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ithjar can't use its tail on another target.

reaction.name: Writhing Escape
reaction.text: When grappled, the ithjar can attempt to escape.

monster.description:
"It takes mere moments for an ithjar to transform from a kite-like swirl of gray and red in the distance to a menace of snapping teeth."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 94

monster.name: Knifewing
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 30 ft.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The knifewing doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Glider
trait.text: The knifewing can't ascend while flying and its altitude decreases by 5 feet for every 30 feet it flies. If flying, the knifewing falls if it doesn't fly at least 30 feet during its turn.

action.name: Knifewing (Flying Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
A knifewing is a gliding lizard about the size of a small dog. Its gliding flaps have hard edges that are sharp while stretched taut when the lizard glides.
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 15

monster.name: Lenchtahg
monster.resist: bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Berserk
trait.text:
Whenever the lenchtahg starts its turn with 54 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 1, the lenchtahg recalls its former life and current agony, and it goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the lenchtahg attacks the nearest creature it can see. It treats all creatures as enemies and makes any opportunity attack it can. Also, it has advantage on attack rolls, but all attack rolls against it have advantage. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the lenchtahg moves as far as it can toward the closest creature.
Once the lenchtahg goes berserk, it remains so until destroyed or it has more than 54 hit points. Also, a fiend can calm the lenchtahg. The lenchtahg must be able to understand the fiend, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the lenchtahg ceases being berserk.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The lenchtahg has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The lenchtahg's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Radiant Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the lenchtahg is subjected to radiant damage from a source other than a lenchtahg, it takes no damage and instead regains hit points equal to half the radiant damage dealt to it.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If the lenchtahg's head survives its demise, the head must be doused in holy water and ritually consecrated in a 1-hour ceremony or be the target of a dispel evil and good spell. If it isn't, then the lenchtahg reappears in 6 days, emerging from a fiery explosion in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the head. Creatures in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 8d6 damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one. The head can't rejuvenate in a holy hallow spell's area.

trait.name: Water Aversion
trait.text: If drenched in 5 gallons or more of water, or any amount of holy water, the lenchtahg has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lenchtahg makes two claw attacks, makes one claw attack and uses radiant gaze once, or uses radiant gaze twice.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage and 9 (2d8) fire damage.

action.name: Radiant Gaze
action.text: The lenchtahg targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it with burning radiance. The target gains no benefit from cover and must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

monster.description:
"The smoky, fiery form hisses and shrieks in a cacophony of anger and confusion. There's something almost holy in the sound."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 51

monster.name: Lesser Avarice Seraph
monster.resist: Radiant, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The seraph's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The seraph can innately cast the following spells, using only verbal components:
• At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, light, minor illusion, thaumaturgy • 1/Day each: identify, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The seraph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Seraphic Weapons
trait.text: The seraph's weapon attacks are magical. When the seraph hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra (2d8) radiant damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The seraph makes three attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage and 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Tempting Call
action.text: The seraph calls out a tempting promise to one creature that can hear it withing 30 feet. The creature must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature cannot take actions for 1 minute, as it dwells on the promise the seraph made. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on a success. Each failed saving throw after the initial failure deals 9 (2d8) psychic damage to the target

monster.spells: detect evil and good, detect magic, light, minor illusion, thaumaturgy, identify, suggestion
monster.description:
"Don't go to the temple. Something sinister has claimed it. Seek shelter elsewhere."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 94

monster.name: Lesser Gluttony Seraph
monster.resist: Radiant, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The seraph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Seraphic Weapons
trait.text: The seraph's weapon attacks are magical. When the seraph hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra (1d8) radiant damage (included in the attacks).

action.name: Innate Spellcasting
action.text:
The seraph's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The seraph can innately cast the following spells, using only verbal components:
• At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, light, thaumaturgy • 1/Day each: create food and water, suggestion

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The seraph makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage and 4 (1d8) radiant damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the seraph can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage and 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 4 (1d8) radiant damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) and pulled to within 5 feet of the seraph. Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the seraph can't use its tongue or bite on another target.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, detect magic, light, thaumaturgy, create food and water, suggestion
monster.description:
"Don't go to the temple. Something sinister has claimed it. Seek shelter elsewhere."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 94

monster.name: Lich Troll
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life and Giant
monster.resist: Cold, Necrotic

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The lich troll is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The lich troll has the following wizard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost • 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror image, misty step • 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, haste • 4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door • 5th level (2 slots): cloudkill, scrying • 6th level (1 slot): create undead

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the lich troll fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The lich troll regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the lich troll takes acid or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of the lich troll's next turn. The lich troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lich troll makes two claw attacks. Alternately, the lich troll can cast chill touch or ray of frost twice.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: The lich troll can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lich troll regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
legendary.text: The lich troll casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Claw
legendary.text: The lich troll makes a claw attack.

monster.spells: chill touch, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, detect thoughts, invisibility, mirror image, misty step, animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, haste, blight, dimension door, cloudkill, scrying, create undead
monster.description:
"Running away from a troll is smart. Running away from a troll that casts spells is wishful thinking."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 121

monster.name: Lindwyrm
monster.resist: bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Disease Immunity
trait.text: The lindwyrm is immune to all nonmagical diseases.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the lindwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lindwyrm makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. The lindwyrm can substitute a swallow attack for one of its claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage and the target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a hit, the target is also grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lindwyrm can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Swallow
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Huge or smaller creature the lindwyrm is grappling. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the lindwyrm, and it takes 27 (6d8) acid damage at the start of each of the lindwyrm's turns. The lindwyrm can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the lindwyrm takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the lindwyrm must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the lindwyrm. If the lindwyrm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: The lindwyrm can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lindwyrm regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
legendary.text: The lindwyrm makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Burrowing Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lindwyrm burrows its speed and comes up beneath a target touching the ground, making a bite attack. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.description:
"My great grandfather spoke of the lindwyrm terrorizing the countryside and devouring whole villages. But it's been so long since anyone has seen the beast, it's likely the creature is long dead. Thank Miklas!"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 58

monster.name: Lupilisk
monster.languages: can learn languages but can't speak
monster.resist: Cold, Fire

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The lupilisk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The lupilisk has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lupilisk's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned and restrained while poisoned in this way. The creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. If the save fails again, the creature is petrified for 24 hours. At that time, it can repeat the saving throw, becoming permanently petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success.

monster.description:
"If you find a statue in the wild with its mouth open in a scream, flee. Best case, it's an artist working out their twisted ideas. Worst case, you'll be a statue soon."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 61

monster.name: Lupilisk Elder
monster.languages: can learn languages but can't speak
monster.resist: Cold, Fire

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The lupilisk elder has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The lupilisk elder has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lupilisk's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned and restrained while poisoned in this way. The creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. If the save fails again, the creature is permanently petrified.

action.name: Pack Attack (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: One lupilisk or lupilisk whelp the lupilisk elder can see within 30 feet of it can use a reaction to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack. The target must be able to hear or see the elder. The lupilisk elder then makes one bite attack.

monster.description:
"If you find a statue in the wild with its mouth open in a scream, flee. Best case, it's an artist working out their twisted ideas. Worst case, you'll be a statue soon."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 62

monster.name: Lupilisk Whelp
monster.languages: can learn languages but can't speak
monster.resist: Cold, Fire

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The lupilisk whelp has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The lupilisk whelp has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lupilisk's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage and 5 (2d4) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned and restrained while poisoned in this way. The creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. If the save fails again, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

monster.description:
"If you find a statue in the wild with its mouth open in a scream, flee. Best case, it's an artist working out their twisted ideas. Worst case, you'll be a statue soon."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 62

monster.name: Malikirian Imp
monster.resist: Cold, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Creeping Corruption
trait.text: Creatures within 30 ft. that the Malikirian imp can see must make a DC 12 Charisma saving throw at the start of their turn. On a failure, the creature acts in accordance with its most selfish, venal, and ruthless impulses to the best of its ability. After 24 hours, the creature must make another Charisma saving throw, ending the compulsion on a success. Failure indicates the compulsion lasts indefinitely until the affected is subject to remove curse or similar magic. Creatures that cannot be charmed are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Malikirian imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The Malikirian imp's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells without material components:
• At will: minor illusion • 1/Day each: detect thoughts, sleep, suggestion

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: -1 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 2) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Invisibility
action.text: The Malikirian imp becomes invisible until its concentration ends or it makes an attack.

monster.spells: minor illusion, detect thoughts, sleep, suggestion
monster.description:
"I can give you anything, mortal. Riches? Accolades? To be important, for once? Whisper your secrets to me. I will tell you the secrets of your rivals. They all dance with me."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 109

monster.name: Mjork
monster.resist: bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Fiery Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the mjork or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The mjork sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Smoke Sense
trait.text: A mjork in contact with smoke has blindsight in that smoke's area in a radius of up to 120 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the mjork moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mjork makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage and 3 (1d6) fire damage.

monster.description:
"Is it just me, or does the darkness seem thicker? And did it just get really warm in here?"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 69

monster.name: Mjork Asher
monster.resist: bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Blinding Soot
trait.text: A creature that takes fire damage from a mjork asher's attacks must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mjork's next turn.

trait.name: Fiery Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the mjork asher or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Smoke Sense
trait.text: A mjork asher in contact with smoke has blindsight in that smoke's area in a radius of up to 120 feet.

trait.name: Smoke Shroud
trait.text: While the mjork asher has 41 or more hit points, smoke renders a sphere within 20 feet of it heavily obscured. This smoke goes around corners. Even while the mjork has 40 or fewer hit points, tendrils of this smoke extend to 60 feet from the mjork, providing smoke for the Smoke Sense of all mjorks. However, the whole shroud dissipates during any round the mjork is exposed to moderate (at least 10 miles per hour) or stronger wind.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the mjork asher moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mjork asher makes two attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage and Blinding Soot.

action.name: Hurl Soot
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, ranged 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) fire damage and Blinding Soot.

action.name: Create Sootlings (1/Day)
action.text: The mjork asher chooses a point within 60 feet of it that it can sense. Smoke fills a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. This smoke lasts until the start of the mjork's next turn or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Unless dispersed before the start of the mjork's next turn, a sootling swarm forms in a space in the area, favoring a space a creature hostile to the mjork occupies. The swarm takes its turn just after the mjork and obeys the mjork's verbal commands (no action for the mjork). If issued no commands, the swarm acts independently, often attacking a creature that isn't its ally. The swarm can survive indefinitely after being created.

monster.description:
"Is it just me, or does the darkness seem thicker? And did it just get really warm in here?"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 71

monster.name: Mjork Burner
monster.resist: bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Fiery Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the mjork burner or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Fire Path
trait.text: The mjork burner leaves fire behind in any space it moves through. Until the start of the mjork's next turn, any creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there takes 5 (2d4) fire damage. The fire can ignite flammable objects (not creatures), causing the mjork's Fire Path to last longer.

trait.name: Ignite
trait.text: A creature or flammable object ignites if it takes fire damage from the mjork burner's attacks. Until a creature takes an action to douse this fire, the target takes 5 (2d4) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The mjork burner sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for another 10 feet.

trait.name: Smoke Sense
trait.text: A mjork burner in contact with smoke has blindsight in that smoke's area in a radius of up to 120 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the mjork burner moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mjork burner makes two attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, 7 (2d6) fire damage, and Ignite.

action.name: Hurl Fire
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, ranged 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) fire damage and Ignite.

monster.description:
"Is it just me, or does the darkness seem thicker? And did it just get really warm in here?"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 71

monster.name: Mjork Charger
monster.resist: bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the mjork charger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage and 3 (1d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

trait.name: Fiery Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the mjork charger or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The mjork charger sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Momentum
trait.text: If the mjork charger moves on its turn before attacking, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls for opportunity attacks against it.

trait.name: Smoke Sense
trait.text: A mjork charger in contact with smoke has blindsight in that smoke's area in a radius of up to 120 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the mjork charger moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mjork makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage.

monster.description:
"Is it just me, or does the darkness seem thicker? And did it just get really warm in here?"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 70

monster.name: Mjork Sootling
monster.languages: understands Ignan and Terran but can't speak

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that ends its turn grappling the sootling takes 1 fire damage.

trait.name: Smoke Sense
trait.text: A sootling in contact with smoke has blindsight in that smoke's area in a radius of up to 120 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the sootling moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Burn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) fire damage.

monster.description:
"Is it just me, or does the darkness seem thicker? And did it just get really warm in here?"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 72

monster.name: Mjork Sootling Swarm
monster.languages: understands Ignan and Terran but can't speak
monster.resist: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious

trait.name: Hot Soot
trait.text: A creature that ends its turn in the sootling swarm's space takes 5 (2d4) fire damage, or 2 (1d4) fire damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The creature must also succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be blinded and unable to breathe until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Smoke Sense
trait.text: A sootling swarm in contact with smoke has blindsight in that smoke's area in a radius of up to 120 feet.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The sootling swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 feet the sootling swarm moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 cold damage.

action.name: Burns
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) fire damage, or 5 (2d4) fire damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.description:
"Is it just me, or does the darkness seem thicker? And did it just get really warm in here?"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 72

monster.name: Mold Spider

trait.name: Regrowth
trait.text: When a mold spider dies, unless fire destroyed it, it releases spores that regrow a mold spider in 3 days.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The mold spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 83

monster.name: Morbus Kobold
monster.resist: Poison

trait.name: Carrier
trait.text: The morbus kobold can contract a disease but is immune to effects other than cosmetic symptoms.

trait.name: Infection
trait.text: A creature that touches the morbus kobold or anything it has touched in the past 24 hours is exposed to a disease, usually sewer plague.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The morbus kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the morbus kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and Infection.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage and Infection.

action.name: Gore Bag
action.text: The morbus kobold throws a sack filled with diseased gore at a point it can see within 20 feet of it. Each creature within 5 feet of the chosen point is subjected to Infection. A kobold usually carries only one such bag at a time.

monster.description:
"If a group of lions is called a pride, a group of morbus kobolds is called an infection."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 29

monster.name: Oblivion Brute
monster.resist: Cold, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the oblivion brute can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in sunlight, the oblivion brute has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Soul Drain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target's available Hit Dice are reduced by 1. If this effect reduces the target's Hit Dice to 0, the target falls unconscious. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, regaining consciousness on a success. Hit Dice lost this way return at the end of a short rest, in time to spend them to regain hit points.
If an oblivion brute kills a living creature with this attack when the creature is at 0 Hit Dice, the target's soul is lost to the realm of shadow. This lost soul can be raised from the dead only with mighty magic, such as wish or divine intervention.

action.name: Unbearable Howl (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text:
The oblivion brute emits a howl in a 30-foot cone. Each creature that isn't deafened or undead in the area must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. While frightened this way, a creature's speed is halved. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any oblivion brute's Unbearable Howl for the next 24 hours.
Frightened: • A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight. • The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

monster.description:
"If you hear the strange, low whistling in the darkness, run! They whistle before they strike, striding out of the darkness, hungry for the souls of the living."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 28

monster.name: Oblivion Juggernaut
monster.resist: Cold, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the oblivion juggernaut can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in sunlight, the oblivion juggernaut has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The oblivion juggernaut uses unbearable roar and then uses soul drain.

action.name: Soul Drain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target's available Hit Dice are reduced by 2. If this effect reduces the target's Hit Dice to 0, the target falls unconscious. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, regaining consciousness on a success. Hit Dice lost this way return at the end of a short rest, in time to spend them to regain hit points.
If an oblivion juggernaut kills a living creature with this attack when the creature is at 0 Hit Dice, the target's soul is lost to the realm of shadow. This lost soul can be raised from the dead only with mighty magic, such as wish or divine intervention.

action.name: Unbearable Roar
action.text: Each creature of the oblivion juggernaut's choice that isn't deafened and is within 120 feet of the juggernaut must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any oblivion juggernaut's Unbearable Roar for 24 hours.

monster.description:
"If you hear the strange, low whistling in the darkness, run! They whistle before they strike, striding out of the darkness, hungry for the souls of the living."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 28

monster.name: Oblivion Leaper
monster.resist: Cold, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained

trait.name: Shadow Leap
trait.text: Starting in an area of dim light or darkness, an oblivion leaper can teleport to an unoccupied space also in dim light or darkness. Every foot of teleportation costs the oblivion leaper 1 foot of movement.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the oblivion leaper can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in sunlight, the oblivion leaper has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Soul Drain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target's available Hit Dice are reduced by 1. If this effect reduces the target's Hit Dice to 0, the target falls unconscious. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, regaining consciousness on a success. Hit Dice lost this way return at the end of a short rest, in time to spend them to regain hit points.
If an oblivion leaper kills a living creature with this attack when the creature is at 0 Hit Dice, the target's soul is lost to the realm of shadow. This lost soul can be raised from the dead only with mighty magic, such as wish or divine intervention.

monster.description:
"If you hear the strange, low whistling in the darkness, run! They whistle before they strike, striding out of the darkness, hungry for the souls of the living."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 27

monster.name: Oblivion Whistler
monster.resist: Cold, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the oblivion whistler can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in sunlight, the oblivion whistler has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

trait.name: Unbearable Whistling
trait.text: Creatures of the oblivion whistler's choice that aren't deafened and start their turn within 30 feet of the oblivion whistler must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. A target that fails is frightened until the start of its next turn and unable to hide the distress of hearing the whistling, which is the source of the fear and considered to be within line of sight while the target can hear and is within 30 feet of it. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to any oblivion whistler's Unbearable Whistling for 1 hour.

action.name: Soul Drain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target's available Hit Dice are reduced by 1. If this effect reduces the target's Hit Dice to 0, the target falls unconscious. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, regaining consciousness on a success. Hit Dice lost this way return at the end of a short rest, in time to spend them to regain hit points.
If an oblivion whistler kills a living creature with this attack when the creature is at 0 Hit Dice, the target's soul is lost to the realm of shadow. This lost soul can be raised from the dead only with mighty magic, such as wish or divine intervention.

monster.description:
"If you hear the strange, low whistling in the darkness, run! They whistle before they strike, striding out of the darkness, hungry for the souls of the living."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 27

monster.name: Oozing Vulture

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The oozing vulture has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The oozing vulture has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description:
"The squawking and flapping of wings didn't cause me to flee. The blood-dripping feathers and gnarled beak? A whole different story."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 38

monster.name: Ordeal Tree
monster.resist: Bludgeoning, Piercing

trait.name: Corrupt Desire
trait.text:
A humanoid may bind themselves to the ordeal tree. Each day the petitioner is bound to the tree, they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 15 + number of days bound or suffer a level of exhaustion. If they survive for 7 days, the ordeal tree may choose to grant a blessing. The tree only does this if the humanoid is evil, once per humanoid. If the humanoid is neutral or good, the tree attacks them.
The blessing is tailored to the petitioner's desires (GM discretion) but might include +1 to an ability score, a feat, expertise in a skill, or the ability to innately cast a 3rd-level (or lower) spell once per day using Charisma as the petitioner's spellcasting ability.
The petitioner also contracts the curse of foul blight (Grim Hallow Campaign Guide). If the petitioner commits a profoundly evil act every day, the curse never advances beyond stage 1. If the petitioner fails to commit the act, the curse automatically escalates.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the ordeal tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Heart Sight
trait.text: The ordeal tree knows the alignment and desires of any creature that binds itself to the tree.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ordeal tree makes two slam attacks and one attack with a vine or enervate.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vine
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) slashing damage, and the creature is grappled (escape DC 17).

action.name: Enervate (2/Day)
action.text: A creature bound to the ordeal tree or grappled by it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer 44 (8d10) necrotic damage. The ordeal tree gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage done.

monster.description:
"In the primeval wood rises the ordeal tree. Should you hang from this hoary pillar of begone time for seven moons, you will gain power of the ancients."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 39

monster.name: Panjaian Ilharan
monster.skill: Acrobatics +5, Deception +3, Perception +4, Sleight Of Hand +5, Stealth +5
monster.resist: Lightning, Thunder

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The panjaian ilharan's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible) • 3/Day each: gust of wind, invisibility (self only)

trait.name: Returning Wind
trait.text: The panjaian ilharan can take a bonus action to choose up to four objects it can see within 60 feet of it. These objects can't be carried or worn by another creature, and they can weigh up to 5 pounds combined. Those objects fly up to 60 feet toward the ilharan, delivered into its hands or open containers, such as sheathes, once within 5 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The panjaian ilharan makes four dagger attacks. It can draw the daggers as part of this action.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Storm Wave (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The panjaian ilharan unleashes lightning, thunder, and strong wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 6 (2d4 + 1) lightning damage and 6 (2d4 + 1) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Those who fail the saving throw are also pushed up to 15 feet to the edge of the area.

action.name: Gift of Flight (1/Day)
action.text: The panjaian ilharan touches up to four willing creatures. Each target gains a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 hour. When the effect ends, the target descends at 60 feet per round for 1 minute, taking no falling damage and landing on its feet if on the ground after that minute.

monster.spells: mage hand, gust of wind, invisibility
monster.description:
"Instilled with the power of the Primordials, panjaians are literal forces of nature."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 96

monster.name: Psychic Fragment
monster.languages: can repeat one phrase it knew in life
monster.resist: Acid, Cold, Fire, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The psychic fragment can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The psychic fragment can mimic a single word or phrase it spoke in life. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 11 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Withering Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) necrotic damage.

monster.description:
"It appeared from the darkness: a faceless wraith whose outstretched arms sought purchase on my mortal frame. In desperation, I cried to my companions for aid, but my voice was silent. When it stole my words, I knew my doom was at hand."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 15

monster.name: Psychic Fragment Swarm
monster.languages: can repeat one phrase it knew in life
monster.resist: Acid, Cold, Fire, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The swarm can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Maddening Voices
trait.text: The swarm constantly emits a babble of words and phrases spoken in life by its many undead spirits. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 ft. of the swarm must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is stunned until the start of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw becomes immune to maddening voices for 24 hours.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Withering Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) necrotic damage, or 10 (3d6) necrotic damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monster.description:
"It appeared from the darkness: a faceless wraith whose outstretched arms sought purchase on my mortal frame. In desperation, I cried to my companions for aid, but my voice was silent. When it stole my words, I knew my doom was at hand."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 15

monster.name: Scream Thief
monster.resist: Acid, Cold, Fire, bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The scream thief can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Silence the Living {@recharge 5}
action.text: The scream thief forces a humanoid within 30 feet of it to make a DC13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage, is frightened, and is unable to vocalize a sound of any kind. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end these effects. On a success the creature takes half as much damage and is not frightened or silenced.

action.name: Silence the Living (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The scream thief forces a humanoid within 30 feet of it to make a DC13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage, is frightened, and is unable to vocalize a sound of any kind. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end these effects. On a success the creature takes half as much damage and is not frightened or silenced.

monster.description:
"It appeared from the darkness: a faceless wraith whose outstretched arms sought purchase on my mortal frame. In desperation, I cried to my companions for aid, but my voice was silent. When it stole my words, I knew my doom was at hand."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 14

monster.name: Sea Drake
monster.resist: Cold

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The sea drake can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sea drake makes one bite attack and one tail attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is pulled within 5 feet of the sea drake and grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the drake can't use its tail on another target.

monster.description:
"Descendants of the great dragons of the mythic past still roam Etharis. They have little of the majesty of their ancestors, but they're still frightening."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 51

monster.name: Shadowsteel Ghast
monster.resist: Necrotic

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The Shadowsteel ghast's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
• At will: chill touch, shocking grasp (both 17th level) • 3/Day each: counterspell, misty step, shield • 2/Day: bestow curse

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Shadowsteel ghast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadowsteel Coat
trait.text: The Shadowsteel ghast is coated in metal armor made of Shadowsteel.

trait.name: Shadowsteel Miasma
trait.text: Creatures of the Shadowsteel ghast's choice that start their turn within 30 feet of the ghast must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from any attack roll or saving throw they make until the start of their next turn. Only one miasma can affect a given creature at a time. A creature that rolls a natural 20 on any attack roll or saving throw while in a Shadowsteel miasma is immune to the miasma of any Shadowsteel ghast for 1 hour.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
trait.text: The Shadowsteel ghast and any Shadowsteel ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Shadowsteel ghast makes two claw attacks or casts one at-will spell and makes one claw attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. A cursed target must make an escalation check. If a target drops to 0 hit points due to this damage and isn't already cursed, they are randomly afflicted with one from among any of the curses in the Grim Hollow Campaign Guide (GM's choice).

monster.spells: chill touch, shocking grasp, counterspell, misty step, shield, bestow curse
monster.description:
"Shards of dark metal pierce the skin of the foul creature. The metal pushes out from within the abomination rather than the other way."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 84

monster.name: Shadowsteel Ghoul

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Shadowsteel ghoul has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadowsteel Coat
trait.text: The Shadowsteel ghoul is coated in metal armor made of Shadowsteel.

trait.name: Shadowsteel Hunger
trait.text: The Shadowsteel ghoul has advantage on attack rolls against creatures carrying or wearing Shadowsteel.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Shadowsteel ghoul makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage and 5 (2d4) necrotic damage. A cursed target must make an escalation check. If a target drops to 0 hit points due to this damage and isn't already cursed, roll 1d4, and the target is afflicted with a curse based on the result: 1-2 Curse of Damned Aging, 3-4 Curse of Foul Blight. (See Grim Hollow Campaign Guide for information on curses and escalation.)

monster.description:
"Shards of dark metal pierce the skin of the foul creature. The metal pushes out from within the abomination rather than the other way."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 84

monster.name: Shatter Corpse
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Glass Spikes
trait.text: Each time a creature makes a melee attack against a shatter corpse, it takes 3 piercing damage. A creature can choose to make an attack with disadvantage to avoid this damage.

trait.name: Loud
trait.text: Creatures have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to hear the approach of a shatter corpse.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The shatter corpse has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the shatter corpse to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the shatter corpse drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage and 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

action.name: Volley of Glass (Recharge 6)
action.text: The shatter corpse flicks a volley of glass shards in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
"The sound of breaking glass startles most, but think twice before going to see what caused it if it is followed by the sound of moaning."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 16

monster.name: Shieldhead

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the shieldhead moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
A shieldhead has a broad bone faceplate to protect itself and to ram foes. An expert rider can also use the bone like a shield. People have domesticated shieldheads for riding.
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 97

monster.name: Sitri Cat

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The Sitri cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Seven Shades of Sitri
trait.text: A humanoid who touches a Sitri cat must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become infected with the Seven Shades of Sitri. If a humanoid succeeds on the saving throw, they're immune to the disease for 24 hours. Carnal urges overwhelm an infected humanoid. When the infected interacts with another non-hostile humanoid, the infected becomes charmed by that humanoid until the subject of the infatuation or their friends harm the infected. The infected can repeat the saving throw once every 24 hours. Current infatuations end when one of these saves succeeds. The disease ends for the infected when they have succeeded on five saving throws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage and Seven Shades of Sitri.

monster.description:
Disease is no stranger to the people of Etharis. The virulent Weeping Pox has devastated towns and families, and the Tears of the Hungerer is rumored to be a poison designed by necromancers. Other afflictions, such as the Seven Shades of Sitri and the Faith Cough, are not deadly but can impede even the strongest body. These diseases can be carried by animals, breaking their normal method of transmission. A twist of nature or foul magic has created carriers, some intentionally and some aggressively, that spread sickness quickly.
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 85

monster.name: Skeleton Cannoneer
monster.languages: understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Dead Firearms
trait.text: The cannon and pistol a skeleton cannoneer uses are nonfunctional as ranged weapons for a creature other than a skeleton cannoneer. For the skeleton cannoneer, the pistol never needs to be reloaded.

action.name: Load
action.text: The skeleton cannoneer loads the dead cannon.

action.name: Dead Cannon
action.text:
The skeleton cannoneer fires its loaded cannon at a point it can see within 500 feet of it, but no closer than 50 feet from it. Each creature within 15 feet of that point must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Alternatively, the cannoneer can choose the cannon as the point of fire. Doing so means the shot goes off inside the cannon, destroying it and increasing each type of damage by 3 (1d6).

action.name: Pistol Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage and 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dead Pistol
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description:
"A line of skeletons marches into the town square with military precision. They raise rifles and take aim at the temple in unison."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 87

monster.name: Skeleton Commander
monster.languages: understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skeleton commander makes two pike attacks.

action.name: Pike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage and 5 (2d4) necrotic damage.

action.name: Warlord Strike (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The skeleton commander makes one pike attack. The commander can use a bonus action to direct another undead who can see or hear the commander to attack the target the commander attacked this turn. That undead can use a reaction to make the attack, adding the commander's proficiency bonus to the damage roll.

reaction.name: Brandish Standard
reaction.text: If an undead the skeleton commander can see within 30 feet of the commander makes an attack roll or saving throw, the commander can brandish the tattered banner on its pike. If the commander does so, the target can add a d4 to its roll, provided it can see the commander and isn't receiving this benefit from another commander.

monster.description:
"A line of skeletons marches into the town square with military precision. They raise rifles and take aim at the temple in unison."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 87

monster.name: Skeleton Rifler
monster.languages: understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Dead Rifle
trait.text: The rifle a skeleton rifler carries is nonfunctional as a ranged weapon for a creature other than a skeleton rifler. For the skeleton rifler, the rifle never needs to be reloaded.

action.name: Bayonet
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage and 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dead Rifle
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage and 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description:
"A line of skeletons marches into the town square with military precision. They raise rifles and take aim at the temple in unison."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 86

monster.name: Skinweaver
monster.resist: Fire

trait.name: Supernaturally Sharp
trait.text: Skinweaver's tanning knives overcome slashing damage resistance (though not immunity).

trait.name: Shocking Visage
trait.text: Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the skinweaver and can see it must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the end of the creature's next turn). Whether a creature succeeds or fails, it cannot be affected by this ability again until it loses sight of the skinweaver (as when the skinweaver moves behind total cover or successfully hides).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skinweaver makes two tanning knife attacks or one tanning knife and one web whip attack.

action.name: Tanning Knife
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Web Whip
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: Attack: +4 to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is pulled up to 20 feet toward the skinweaver.

action.name: Web Net (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by leathery webbing. As an action, the restrained target can attempt a DC 13 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 10; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

monster.description:
"I don't brook with tanners no longer. If ya' know what's good for you, ya' won't ask me why."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 30

monster.name: Sky Drake

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The sky drake doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The sky drake has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sky drake makes one bite attack and one attack with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage and 5 (2d4) lightning damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description:
"Descendants of the great dragons of the mythic past still roam Etharis. They have little of the majesty of their ancestors, but they're still frightening."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 63

monster.name: Sloth Galloper

trait.name: Speed Burst
trait.text: Provided it isn't moving over difficult terrain, the sloth galloper can use a bonus action to take the Dash action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sloth galloper makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
A sloth galloper is a hybrid sloth-ape that is an agile climber and fast sprinter. The beast's four apelike hands are sensitive, so it hesitates to move rapidly over rough terrain.
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 97

monster.name: Snapjaw

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: Snapjaw can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Snapjaw makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (3d10 + 15) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Snapjaw can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by Snapjaw. Hit: 24 (2d8 + 15) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 36

monster.name: Spythronar Sac
monster.conditionImmune: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: The spythronar sac appears to be a tangled ball of string, twigs, and dirt. Someone who can see the sac can identify it with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana or Nature) check.

trait.name: Fragile
trait.text: A creature who enters the spythronar sac's space must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, or the sac is destroyed.

trait.name: Lightning Release
trait.text: When the spythronar sac is destroyed, it releases lightning in a 10-foot radius. A creature who destroyed the sac by entering its space receives no saving throw. Other creatures in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) lightning damage. Each spythronar swarm and web in this area instead gains advantage on its next attack roll.

trait.name: Shocking Birth
trait.text: When a spythronar sac takes lightning damage from a source other than another spythronar, it hatches, transforming into a spythronar swarm with half the normal hit points. This swarm rolls initiative and enters the combat.

monster.description:
"Armored corpses in the cavern, resting among thick strands of webbing, have sparks of lightning playing off them."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 31

monster.name: Spythronar Swarm
monster.resist: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing
monster.conditionImmune: Charmed, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Prone, Restrained, Stunned

trait.name: Furtive
trait.text: The spythronar swarm can use a bonus action to take the Hide action.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The spythronar swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The spythronar swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny arachnid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the spythronar swarm knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spythronar swarm ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) lightning damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage and 4 (1d8) lightning damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Weave (4/Day)
action.text:
The spythronar swarm weaves webbing, covering a 5-foot square. The swarm can then give up 1 hit point to create a spythronar sac in that space. If the swarm's webbing covers a 10-foot square, it can give up 23 hit points as part of the same action, creating a spythronar web with the same number of hit points. The swarm can't drop to 0 hit points to create a sac or web.
If the swarm weaves an incomplete web, that web is a normal web rather than a sentient, monstrous one. A creature that enters this normal web's space must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or become grappled (escape DC 10) and restrained while grappled in this way. Each 5-foot square of this web has AC 10; the damage vulnerabilities, immunities, and resistances of a spythronar web; and 5 hit points.

monster.description:
"Armored corpses in the cavern, resting among thick strands of webbing, have sparks of lightning playing off them."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 32

monster.name: Spythronar Web
monster.resist: Bludgeoning, Piercing
monster.conditionImmune: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Unconscious

trait.name: Adhesive
trait.text: The spythronar web adheres to anything that touches it. To avoid adhering when touching the web, a creature must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw, but a creature hit by the web's crush attack doesn't receive a saving throw. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the web is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). If adhered to a target larger than it can grapple, the web can release the adhesive or remain adhered and be dragged along as the target moves. Neither choice requires an action from the web. Removing an object adhered to the web or the web from anything it's adhered to requires a successful DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check as an action.

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The spythronar web can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the spythronar web remains motionless and takes no action, it is indistinguishable from a large, thick spider web.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: A spythronar web can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
trait.text: While in contact with a web, the spythronar web knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The spythronar web ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Crush
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and Adhesive. The target is also restrained while grappled in this way, and the spythronar web can't crush another target.

action.name: Lightning Surge
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage. If the spythronar web has a creature grappled and attacks another target, the grappled creature also takes this damage.

monster.description:
"Armored corpses in the cavern, resting among thick strands of webbing, have sparks of lightning playing off them."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 32

monster.name: Stormborn Ithjar

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The stormborn ithjar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Slippery Serpent
trait.text: The stormborn ithjar has advantage on ability checks or saving throws made to escape a grapple and saving throws to avoid being paralyzed or restrained.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The stormborn ithjar attacks once with its bite and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage and 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) thunder damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the stormborn ithjar can't use its tail on another target.

action.name: Storm Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The stormborn ithjar exhales a 30-foot cone of lightning and thunder. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 (7d8) lightning damage and 31 (7d8) thunder damage and falls prone. If the save succeeds, the creature takes half the lightning and thunder damage and doesn't fall prone. The discharge of this breath weapon is audible for 1 mile outside and 300 feet inside.

monster.description:
"It takes mere moments for an ithjar to transform from a kite-like swirl of gray and red in the distance to a menace of snapping teeth."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 94

monster.name: Thornlamm
monster.resist: Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Needles
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
"The temptation to aid a lost lamb should be tamped down when a thornlamm appears. Where there is one, there are many. And all lead back to a creature far more terrifying than any big, bad wolf."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 90

monster.name: Torcheater

trait.name: Eat Fire
trait.text: If the torcheater flies through fire, it reduces the fire's area by a 1-foot cube. A fire goes out if its area is reduced to nothing.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft.one target. Hit: 1 fire damage.

monster.description:
Torcheaters are small batlike creatures that feed on fire, swooping down to douse torches and campfires.
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 73

monster.name: Venomous Gnoll
monster.resist: Poison

trait.name: Rampage
trait.text: When the venomous gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The venomous gnoll makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and 2 (1d4) poison damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage and 2 (1d4) poison damage.

action.name: Spine Spike
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and 2 (1d4) poison damage.

monster.description:
"I never believed the rumors about the Beast and how it could change people. Then I saw how everyone at the logging camp had been transformed. It had to be a power even greater than a god's."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 60

monster.name: Vitebriate

trait.name: Unnatural Life
trait.text: Vitebriates are immune to the effects of old age and death by natural causes.

trait.name: Vitebriance
trait.text: While on the same plane of existence as a person charmed by the vitebriate's Dominate Person action, the vitebriate may leech 1 hp per day permanently from the thrall. When a thrall is reduced to 0 hp through this process, it is killed. Drained hit points are regained after 7 days of rest.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The vitebriate makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Dominate Person
action.text: A vitebriate can target a single humanoid with dominate person as the spell, with the following differences: once the vitebriate has chosen the target, it can use this ability only on the chosen target (until the next day when it can choose a different target and drop the focus on the current target). The spell does not require concentration but is broken if the vitebriate is knocked unconscious involuntarily or killed (though not if it trances or sleeps). If the person has been charmed for at least an hour, damage does not force a new saving throw.

reaction.name: Life Shield (1/Day)
reaction.text: The vitebriate uses its psychic link with its thrall to transfer all damage it would take to its thrall. Damage that goes beyond what would kill the thrall is dealt to the vitebriate.

monster.description:
"I swear I've seen that kid before, years ago, when I was just a kid myself! But she hasn't aged a day."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 21

monster.name: Werebear Ascetic
monster.speed: walk 30 ft. (50 ft. and 30 ft. climb in hybrid and kindred form)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The werebear is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast spells in any form, regardless of verbal, somatic, or material components provided they have no gold cost. It has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, mending, resistance • 1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, faerie fire, healing word • 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, lesser restoration • 3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, dispel magic, plant growth • 4th level (3 slots): freedom of movement, ice storm • 5th level (2 slots): commune with nature, tree stride • 6th level (1 slot): wall of thorns • 7th level (1 slot): arboreal curse

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The werebear ascetic can use its action to polymorph into a bear-humanoid hybrid or into its kindred bear form, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, unless noted, are the same in each form. Any armor it is wearing merges into its alternate forms. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Kindred Form
trait.text: The werebear's kindred form takes the shape of a Large bear. While in this form, it can speak to and understand bears, cannot take any actions requiring hands, adds its Constitution modifier to the result of any saving throw, and gains 25 temporary hit points the first time it takes this form each day.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The werebear makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite (Hybrid or Kindred Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Hybrid or Kindred Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, mending, resistance, animal friendship, faerie fire, healing word, hold person, lesser restoration, conjure animals, dispel magic, plant growth, freedom of movement, ice storm, commune with nature, tree stride, wall of thorns, arboreal curse
monster.description:
