"During full moons, inhabitants of Etharis stay inside with the doors barred and windows tightly shut. Even then, they look at those indoors with them with a suspicious eye. One never knows."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 37

monster.name: Werewolf Ravager
monster.speed: walk 30 ft. (50 ft. in hybrid form)
monster.vulnerable: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that are silvered
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Grappler
trait.text: While a creature is grappled by the werewolf ravager, the werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against grappled targets, and the target takes an additional 3 1d6 damage whenever it is hit with the werewolf's bite or claw attack.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Any armor it is wearing merges into its hybrid form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The werewolf ravager makes two melee attacks. It can only make one bite attack per turn.

action.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be grappled.
Additionally, if the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Short Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description:
"During full moons, inhabitants of Etharis stay inside with the doors barred and windows tightly shut. Even then, they look at those indoors with them with a suspicious eye. One never knows."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 83

monster.name: Xakalonus

trait.name: Magic Absorption
trait.text: If a xakalonus succeeds on a saving throw against a magical effect that would damage it, it takes no damage. Instead, the xakalonus regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Alternatively, if the xakalonus is at full hit points, the next successful melee attack by the xakalonus deals an additional 11 (2d10) force damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The xakalonus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The xakalonus makes one bite and one claws attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Sonic Bark (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: All creatures within 30 ft. who can hear the xakalonus must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) thunder damage and be stunned until the end of their next turn. Other xakalonus and the hraptnon are immune to this.

monster.description:
"The Stillborn Forest crawls with these beasts, and their howls foretell even larger monsters approaching."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 73

monster.name: Young Blightscale Dragon

trait.name: Accursed Death
trait.text: When the dragon dies, it exudes a cloud of sickening, accursed gas. Each creature within 20 ft. of the dragon must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. However, a creature that fails two of these saving throws becomes cursed. A creature cursed in this way takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points, and the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. Every 24 hours, the cursed creature takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage with similar reduction to the creature's hit point maximum. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage and 5 (2d4) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage and 2 (1d4) poison damage.

action.name: Swarm Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a 30-foot cone of poisonous insects and vile gas. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) piercing damage and 28 (8d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
"Dragons are rare, so seeing one is terrifying. Seeing one rotting before your eyes as it approaches? Mind-shattering!"
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 82

monster.name: Zombie Troll
monster.resist: Cold, Necrotic

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The zombie troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zombie troll takes acid or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zombie troll's next turn. The zombie troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zombie troll makes two attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unrelenting Brute
action.text: If a creature is hit by both morningstar attacks, the creature must take a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description:
"Running away from a troll is smart. Running away from a troll that casts spells is wishful thinking."
Source: Grim Hollow: Lairs of Etharis p. 121
